theme.temario: Unit 1: Greetings, courtesy forms, formal introductions and farewells according to the context

preguntas.pregunta: How can you introduce yourself in a formal way?
opciones: “Good morning. I am...“ or “Hello, my name is…“
“I hope to see you again“ or “I hope to see you soon“
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: “Good morning. I am...“ or “Hello, my name is…“

preguntas.pregunta: Is it correct to ask this question?: “How are you?“
What would you answer after the client has introduced himself?
opciones: “Pleased to meet you“ or “(It is) nice to meet you“
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: “Pleased to meet you“ or “(It is) nice to meet you“

preguntas.pregunta: Point out which greeting you would never use in the cabinet.
What is the proper treatment for a married woman?
What sentences are commonly used when saying a goodbye in a formal letter?
When saying goodbye, within a FORMALITY, we can use expressions such as:
To which category belong these expressions? (You may rely on me, Count on me, I am at your disposal / service)
When giving an apology, within a FORMALITY, we can use expressions such as:
To which category belong these expressions? (Have a nice day!, Good bye!, See you later, I hope to see you soon)
What is the best material to use when protecting a wound?
The elixir is known as a:
opciones: Cream or gel to spread over the infected area
Tablet or pill to shallow or dissolve in water
Sweet liquid based on active ingredients dissolved in water and alcohol
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: Sweet liquid based on active ingredients dissolved in water and alcohol

preguntas.pregunta: What do you take when you have a headache?
What is the name of a medicine made by dissolving a drug in alcohol?
Pain killers can be found in....
What are considered topical products?
___________________ is a substance used to stimulate inmunity to a particular infectious disease or pathogen
An example of intravenous medicine is....
A device used for measuring the concentration of sugar in the blood:
What does over-the-counter medicine mean?
opciones: A restricted medicine that requires medical authorization
An imported medicine that comes from abroad
A medicine that can be sold without prescription
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: A medicine that can be sold without prescription

preguntas.pregunta: How do we show interest in what the client tell us?
“What I'm trying to say is that“... It is used to give our opinion on something.
Point out which answer does not correspond to the question asked:
opciones: What are your own feelings about...?  /  Personally, I believe...
Have you come to any conclusion about...?  /  I'm convinced that...
Are you feeling OK?  /  Yes, I feel good
How do you see...?  /  I don't see nothing
What do you think about...?  /  In my opinion...
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: How do you see...?  /  I don't see nothing

preguntas.pregunta: How do we show our conformity to an opinion?
opciones: It doesn't much matter to me

preguntas.pregunta: Point out the expressions that express disagreement:
opciones: I am afraid I can't agree with you
It depends on your point of view
respuestaCorrecta: It depends on your point of view
I am afraid I can't agree with you

preguntas.pregunta: For me personally, this is a really   point of view
Question: - “So, do you agree with me?“  Answer: - “I totally agree with you“. It is a correct answer?
It _______ on your point of view
Which sentence is not related to 'disagreeing'?
opciones: Yes, but don't you think that…?
I'm afraid I can't agree with you
Yes, you have a point there
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: Yes, you have a point there

preguntas.pregunta: “Go ahead!“ is a expression which belongs to...

theme.temario: Unit 4: The human body. Parts and systems

preguntas.pregunta: What part of the body DOES NOT belong to a body organ
The organ that pumps your blood around your body
Which of these do not correspond to a part of the arm
What body system is in charge of blood production, maintenance of fluid balance, and defense against disease?
The muscle at the bottom of your mouth that tastes things and helps you pronounce words
What is the body system in charge of protecting the body against damage?
Everybody can smell things with and breathe through it
The neck connects your head with your shoulders and the rest of your body....
The joint between your leg and your foot
Used to talk, to eat and to breathe

theme.temario: Unit 5: Ask a question, request a clarification or deal with a complaint

preguntas.pregunta: If we ask a polite question we use the expression:
opciones: “Can I have it?“ or “Could I have it?“
“Do you mind if...?“ or “Would you let me...?“
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: “Do you mind if...?“ or “Would you let me...?“

preguntas.pregunta: How do we ask the customer if they understand us?
opciones: Do we the customer understand us?

preguntas.pregunta: What expressions do we use if we have comprehension problems?
Claim expressions:
To deal with a complaint we use: “Be patient and empathetic“.
The best way to react to the claim starts with a question and ends with a follow up process
Customer assistance starts with an explanation and ends up with a calm atmosphere and a straight control of the situation
It is believed that offering discounts to apologize for the inconvenience caused can help customer satisfaction
What is the most challenging part of customer service?
If we haven't understood what the client has said, the proper way to proceed is to
opciones: Pretend you have not heard him/her
Do not pay attention to it

theme.temario: Unit 6: The anamnesis and vital signs

preguntas.pregunta: Anamnesis:
opciones: It is the clinical exploration process
It is carried out through questioning to personally identify the individual
Helps to determine the relevant family, environmental and personal elements of a person
It is to learn about the person's current ailments and obtain a retrospective of him or her

preguntas.pregunta: Some anamnesis questions could be about…
Which is not a vital sign
Normal body temperature of an adult:
opciones: It only can be taken orally
None of the options are correct

preguntas.pregunta: Normal body temperature of an adult (considering measurement methods):
opciones: Can be taken rectally that tends to be 0.5 to 0.7 degrees higher than orally
It cannot be taken under the arm
Can be taken by ear with a normal thermometer
It cannot be taken orally with the classic glass thermometer
Can be taken by skin with a normal thermometer
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: Can be taken rectally that tends to be 0.5 to 0.7 degrees higher than orally

preguntas.pregunta: The pulse rate…
opciones: …may not fluctuate and increase with illness
...may not fluctuate and increase with exercise
…measures the number of times the heart beats per minute
…may not fluctuate and increase with emotions
…cannot indicate heart rhythm and strength of the pulse
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: …measures the number of times the heart beats per minute

preguntas.pregunta: 60 to 100 beats per minute is…
opciones: …the range of normal pulse of a healthy adult
...the range normal pulse of a baby born
…the ideal heart rate of an athlete during the competition
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: …the range of normal pulse of a healthy adult

preguntas.pregunta: Respiration rate. Which sentence is not correct?
opciones: The normal for an adult person at rest ranges from 12 to 16 breaths per minute
It is the number of breaths a person takes per minute
Consists of counting the number of breaths for 1 minute by counting how many times the chest rises

preguntas.pregunta: The blood pressure is measured in…
Choose the correct answer
opciones: Hypertension and Hypotension are the same
Hypertersion can cause dizziness and fainting in some people

theme.temario: Unit 7: Other forms of communication. Telephone messages and the email

preguntas.pregunta: With what expression do we introduce ourselves on the phone?
opciones: This is ... speaking. How can I help you?
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: This is ... speaking. How can I help you?

preguntas.pregunta: Making appointments. Choose the incorrect:
opciones: Would you like to arrange a meeting with…?
Would you like to arrange an appointment to...?
Please, confirm if this appointment is suitable / convenient for you.
Would you like to arrange an appointment with...?

preguntas.pregunta: Leaving a message: Would you like to leave a message?
What advices or expressions should be taken into account when writing the email?
opciones: I am writing in reference to your request / with regard to / in response to...
respuestaCorrecta: I am writing in reference to your request / with regard to / in response to...

preguntas.pregunta: Greetings and goodbyes in an email:
opciones: I look forward to hearing from you

preguntas.pregunta: I am _______ on behalf of Mrs. Lopez
I would like to _______ to Mr. Brad, please
Which question would we use to put the interlocutor on hold?
opciones: Can you hold on a moment, please?
Will you tell him to call me back?
Can I speak to Mrs. Ann, please?
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: Can you hold on a moment, please?

preguntas.pregunta: John speaking, _______ can I help you?
John speaking, ______ can I help you with?
Which is not a key factor among consumers for turning to OTC medicines?
Lack of time has increased the use of OTC medicines for daily needs
Pharmaceutical companies must develop a marketing strategy to successfully advertise their goods and services.
OTC means...
opciones: a medicine that can be bought with a prescription (doctor's order)

preguntas.pregunta: Which is a key factor among consumers for turning to OTC medicines?
The best OTC marketing tactics are:
It is the best free advertising that exists and is one of the most useful due to its high effectiveness
What products are not considered OTC?
There is not a growing trend to consume products based on natural herbs to combat stress or insomnia, slimming products and personal care items.
Who is in charge to cross-sell and upsell?
A question can be asked in different ways. Indicate the incorrect one:
opciones: This is all the information I have.
I wonder if you could tell me ...?
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: This is all the information I have.

preguntas.pregunta: If some information is requested from us, it could be communicated in the following way: 'Can you send me information about...?'
To offer a client the help he needs, we can do it with the following expressions:
opciones: If you need anything else, do not hesitate to contact us again.
I send you the information you requested.
I will contact you as soon as I can.
respuestaCorrecta: If you need anything else, do not hesitate to contact us again.
I will contact you as soon as I can.
I send you the information you requested.

preguntas.pregunta: When the client has doubts regarding the date or time of the appointment, he will notify us as follows:
opciones: Could you confirm me when the appointment is?
I don't know anything about (…). Sorry.
respuestaCorrecta: Could you confirm me when the appointment is?

preguntas.pregunta: With what expression can information be required?
opciones: There are aspects of this case where I have doubts.
No, please do not send me any advertising. I'm not interested.
Remember, there is no obligation to buy.
I am sending you the information you have requested.

preguntas.pregunta:
- How to express a request?

- Start with a _______ formula
In the case that we need to formulate an order, it is recommended to soft it with formulas such as...
The conversation is the channel that enables us... (choose the incorrect one)
opciones: Offer the customer the help they need
Solve possible misunderstandings in the information

preguntas.pregunta: When requesting specific information, the type of information will condition the use of  ________, as appropriate.

Although our request begins with an interrogative structure, the order of the words follows the affirmative format:
SUBJECT + VERB

preguntas.pregunta: What is generally considered the most challenging part of customer service?
Which basic pharmacy expression asks about the recommended frequency for taking medication?
opciones: Do you have a prescription for this drug?
Does it have any side effects?
How often should I take these pills?
What can I take for a headache?
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: How often should I take these pills?

opciones: This is all the information I have.
I wonder if you could tell me ...?
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: This is all the information I have.

preguntas.pregunta: When saying goodbye within a formal context, we can use expressions such as:
How is an 'Illness' defined in the provided medical terminology text?
opciones: An unhealthy condition of the body or the mind
A severe, often chronic, medical condition
The study of the origin and nature of a disease
Physical harm caused by an accident or attack
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: An unhealthy condition of the body or the mind

opciones: Do not pay attention to it
Pretend you have not heard him/her

preguntas.pregunta: Which pharmacy phrase indicates that usage instructions can be found on the medicine's container?
opciones: Do you have anything for migraine?
Which pharmacy is on duty tonight?
Take this medicine for a sore throat.
Take a pill after each meal.
The dosage instructions are labelled on the package.
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: The dosage instructions are labelled on the package.

preguntas.pregunta: Point out which greeting you would never use when addressing a client formally in a professional setting (like a cabinet/office).
According to the pharmacy marketing document, online pharmacies can sell which type of medicines?
opciones: Medicines that do not require a prescription (OTC)
Only medicines approved for online sale by a doctor
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: Medicines that do not require a prescription (OTC)

preguntas.pregunta: What is 'anamnesis' defined as in the medical context provided?
opciones: The number of breaths taken per minute
The clinical exploration process carried out through questioning
The count of heartbeats per minute
The measurement of the body's core temperature
preguntas.respuestaCorrecta: The clinical exploration process carried out through questioning

opciones: Would you like to arrange a meeting with…?

opciones: 'Good morning. I am...' or 'Hello, my name is…'
